plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A striking perennial lily with large, fragrant white flowers that have been cultivated since ancient times. It blooms in mid to late summer, producing elegant trumpet-shaped flowers.
plants.funFact: Madonna lilies have long been symbols of purity and have appeared in religious art and symbolism across cultures.

plants.name: Rhododendron ferrugineum
plants.description: A hardy shrub native to the European Alps and Pyrenees, producing clusters of bell-shaped pink to reddish flowers. It thrives in high-altitude cooler climates and blooms in midsummer.
plants.funFact: Despite its name, the Alpine Rose is not a true rose but a rhododendron species adapted to harsh mountain environments.

plants.name: Nymphaea lotus
plants.description: An aquatic plant with large, fragrant white to pink flowers that open during the day and close at night. It thrives in tropical and subtropical freshwater habitats.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, with peak bloom in summer (July)
plants.location: Africa and parts of Southeast Asia
plants.funFact: The Tiger Lotus was historically sacred in ancient Egyptian culture, symbolizing rebirth and the sun.

plants.name: Heliotropium arborescens
plants.description: A shrubby perennial known for its clusters of small, intensely fragrant purple flowers that attract pollinators like butterflies and bees. It blooms profusely in summer.
plants.location: Native to Peru, popular in gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Heliotrope's name comes from Greek words meaning 'sun-turner' because its flowers were once believed to turn toward the sun.
